intro: Mendoncia obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate mendoncia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
